oai_dc:dc.dc:descriptions: A dead Sorcerer, name !nuin|kúïten, asked by the narrator’s father for rain; which speedily came. In the Katkop dialect, by Díä!kwãin (L V.
ttin, prays to his ancestor, the dead rainmaker !nuin
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: How Xaa
ttin asked (or prayed to) the dead magician (named !nuin
|kui
ten) for rain, which was speedily bestowed
